com.serialpundit.core

Class SerialComSystemProperty

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.serialpundit.core.SerialComSystemProperty

  • public final class SerialComSystemProperty
extends java.lang.Object

    Provides Java system properties to the callers in a unified way.

    Author:
    Rishi Gupta

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SerialComSystemProperty()
      Allocates a new SerialComSystemProperty object.

      Locate home directory for Java.

      Gives system/user temp directory as returned by JVM.

      Gives the vendor of java virtual machine in use.

      Identifies operating system architecture (not of JRE).

      • getOSName

        public java.lang.String getOSName()
                           throws java.lang.SecurityException

        Identifies operating system serialpundit is running on.

        Returns:
        operating system identified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if security manager does not allow access to system property.

      • getOSArch

        public java.lang.String getOSArch()
                           throws java.lang.SecurityException

        Identifies operating system architecture (not of JRE).

        Application should use getOSType() defined in SerialComPlatform class instead of this method.

        Returns:
        architecture of processor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if security manager does not allow access to system property.

      • getJavaVmVendor

        public java.lang.String getJavaVmVendor()
                                 throws java.lang.SecurityException

        Gives the vendor of java virtual machine in use.

        Returns:
        vendor of JVM.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if security manager does not allow access to system property.

      • getJavaHome

        public java.lang.String getJavaHome()
                             throws java.lang.SecurityException

        Locate home directory for Java.

        Returns:
        home directory for Java stuff.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if security manager does not allow access to system property.

      • getJavaIOTmpDir

        public java.lang.String getJavaIOTmpDir()
                                 throws java.lang.SecurityException

        Gives system/user temp directory as returned by JVM.

        Returns:
        tmp directory for Java operations.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if security manager does not allow access to system property.

      • getUserHome

        public java.lang.String getUserHome()
                             throws java.lang.SecurityException

        Gives home directory of the user currently associated with this process.

        Returns:
        home directory of current user.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if security manager does not allow access to system property.
